intro: Phaenopyrum carolinianum, commonly known as the Carolina sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are usually pink or purple, which bloom in the summer months. It has slender, branching stems and small, narrow leaves. Phaenopyrum carolinianum is often found in open habitats such as roadsides, fields, and forest edges.
